text: Naturalism was a 19th century literary movement. It was a development of the realism movement. Realism attempted to show subjects as they actually were, honestly and naturally. Naturalism added scientific elements such as environment and heredity to fictional characters.Richard Daniel Lehan, Realism and Naturalism: The Novel in an Age of Transition (Madison: University of Wisconsin Press, 2005), p. 3 Unlike realism, naturalism used characters who were of the lower classes. It was also known for themes including taboo and violence. Ã‰mile Zola was the best-known writer of the literary school of naturalism. He was joined by other writers such as Gustave Flaubert, and Alphonse Daudet. == References == == Related pages == *Naturalism (arts) *Naturalism (philosophy) Category:Literature
title: Naturalism (literature)
